CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1940 reads: "Mess Time At Fort Bragg Is One Of The Biggest Events Of The Day - An Army Must Eat And These Chefs Handle The Job - Part of the responsibility of feeding the 3,000 Negro soldiers at Fort Bragg falls upon the men pictured above...Center photo shows some of the recruits lined up waiting to get their "Chow"! - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Soldiers holding pans lined up outside one story clapboard mess hall with circular tents in background, Fort Bragg, North Carolina
CatSubject_tab: Soldiers--North Carolina--Fort Bragg.Men--North Carolina--Fort Bragg.Fort Bragg (N.C.)
